segments.text: Patricia, thanks for taking my call. I wanted to give you a quick update on our readiness for Riverside.
Perfect timing. The board meets tomorrow and Riverside is on the agenda. What's your status?
We're locked in on all our subcontractors. Miller Electric, ClimaTech HVAC, all confirmed and ready to commit once we get your approval.
Good. And you're still confident on the timeline? Eighteen months to occupancy?
Yes. We've built buffer time into the schedule. Even if we hit weather delays or supply hiccups, we'll make the deadline.
That's what I need to hear. The board is nervous about timeline risk. Too many projects in this market are running 6-12 months over.
I understand. We've completed our last eight projects on time or early. Our track record speaks for itself.
Which is why you're our top choice. Between you and me, the board is leaning heavily in your direction.
That's great to hear. We're really excited about this project. It's exactly the kind of work we excel at.
One question came up in our finance committee - the value engineering options. Can you walk me through those again?
Sure. The base bid is 12.8 million. We can hit your 12 million target by switching the facade from aluminum panels to fiber cement.
None. Fiber cement has a 50-year warranty, same performance specs. The only difference is aesthetics - aluminum has a more premium look.
Honestly, I think the fiber cement looks great in the samples you showed me. And 800k savings is significant.
It gives you budget flexibility for interior finishes or landscaping. Better to invest where tenants will actually notice.
Smart thinking. Alright James, I'm going to recommend we move forward with you. Expect to hear from me Friday afternoon.
Thank you Patricia. We won't let you down. This is going to be a great partnership.
